New Records: Bradley Beal scored 25 points, matching 10/15 from the field and 3/3 from the free throw line.
Kevin Durant scored 23 points, including back-to-back fade-away jumpers and a reverse layup.
Ryan Dunn was efficient with 15 points, including multiple three-pointers, and defensively guarded Paul George.
Key Match Events: The Suns had a massive third-quarter surge, outscoring the 76ers 36-27 after Bradley Beal's scoring.
Kevin Durant capitalized on mismatches and scored key baskets to maintain the lead.
The game was high-pressure as the Suns ended a four-game losing streak.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was seen as a crucial step toward the championship for the Suns.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was an inter-conference duel.
Joel Embiid's absence was a significant factor for the 76ers.
